text: I'm John Harwood with the New York Times
in CNBC 24 hours after barack obama's
big victory in north carolina and narrow
defeat in indiana he is trying today to
leverage his growing advantages as the
front-runner as he inches closer to the
nomination he and his team are pressing
uncommitted super-delegates to decide
now and settle this race rather than
wait Hillary Clinton by contrast is
fighting simply to stay alive preserve
her political options financially she's
tried to do that by lending her campaign
another six million dollars to try to
stay in the game against Barack Obama's
big financial advantage and politically
she and her aides are trying to lobby
those uncommitted super-delegates not to
decide now to hold off while she waits
for a political miracle that might
dramatically enhance her support and
undercut Barack Obama's no sign of that
today he picked up another four
super-delegates that's a faster pace
than before one a defection from Hillary
Clinton's camp House and Senate
Democrats though nervous about Obama's
recent struggles have become
increasingly certain that Barack Obama
is going to be the nominee that will
help him further politically now
Clinton's advisers say that she's not
going to drop out of the race anytime
soon at least for one more week that
could help Obama because she's certain
to win in West Virginia next week with
all those working-class white voters who
are Hillary Clinton stronghold it would
embarrass Obama if he lost the state
after Clinton had dropped out one the
next potential stopping point could be
May twentieth when we have primaries in
Oregon and Kentucky that's when the
Obama team says that they will
accumulate a majority of pledged
delegates by that point but other
Clinton advisors I talked to insist you
will go all the way through the end of
the primaries on jun 3rd in Montana and
South Dakota and after some resolution
is achieved for the voters in Michigan
in Florida where she has been claiming
that she won both of those disputed
states after that one Clinton advisor
told me if she falls short she will make
a graceful exit and it's significant to
note that she did not attack Barack
Obama today
